name: Holiday Inn Express Harrisburg NE

reviews.text: Another great stay at another great Holiday Inn Express. However, this one was a little different. It was brand new, very modern and still had that "new car smell". Hopefully Trip Advisor or Holiday Inn staff will move to erase all of these terrible reviews because they are dated and meant for the Comfort Inn that once stood. Regardless, stay here and you will see for yourself...it is worth every penny. I called around noon to see if it was possible to get my room ready early, front desk staff Rick was very nice and said he would do everything in his power to make sure our room was ready. Once we arrived, Rick greeted me at the front desk and said "we have your room ready sir". Awesome! Thanks Rick~! And thanks to the nice Asian lady who hooked us up with a crib at the last minute (w/ sheets and blanket). This hotel is located right off I-81 on Highway 39. Hwy 39 will take you right to Hershey Park, 10min drive. This is the best hotel on the block!
reviews.title: Brand Spankin' New
Recently opened under new name
reviews.text: This hotel recently opened under the Holiday Inn Express name and I've heard it has been remodeled. t doesn't seem fair that TripAdvisor is giving this newly purchased hotel the reviews from the old, in-need-of-work Comfort Inn that held the property previously. Can someone do something about that? And, the photos might be wrong, too, since this is newly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel looked brand new to us but we have no idea if it is. The location was really nice, not in the city but not far and very quiet and serene. The rooms are large and well furnished with ample lights over the bed and finally a hotel with bedside outlets so we could plug up both of our phones. There was a lot of counter space and a pull out table to eat on and two arm chairs, the tv was high up on the wall so lying in bed and watching tv was nicer. The fridge was great it was roomy and had a separate freezer. It is better than your average HIE. The pool was very nice but freezing and the hot tub was hot but the jets were not working properly at the time. We used the laundry room and the wash was fine but the dryer broke and we couldn't dry, hope they fixed those two minor problems, this hotel gets an A+ from us.
reviews.title: Amazing and Unexpected

reviews.text: Stayed here for two night last week. I was impressed with how clean and well taken care of the hotel was. Rooms are large and modern. Decent amount of choices for breakfast (though I was hoping for a pancake machine but they didn't have one) Hotel has a large business center, pool and fitness center. A+ service and accommodations!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: My husband and myself stayed for labor day weekend. HIE was very clean the rooms where up to date. My only complant was we couldnt get in right away and the ac made weird noise. Besides that clean , Perkins across the street if you don't want the very nice continental spread only 15 minutes from Hershey.
reviews.title: Nice room very clean good location
Good
reviews.text: We stayed for a night and were very satisfied with this place, very clean and breakfast was good. Staff are very accomadative to our needs. Room comes with a microwave and a refrigerator and absolutely worth the money spent....

My family of 4 stayed for 2 nights as we visited Hershey Park. The park is around 10 minutes down the road. Room was clean, staff was responsive to our needs. Breakfast was your standard HIE fare - which is a good thing. Will return when we go back to Hershey.
reviews.title: Close to Hershey, good stay

reviews.text: Our family stay was June18-19,2012. This hotel was formerly a Comfort Inn,and we also stayed there in the past.
reviews.title: Well Done!
Great stop! Very clean and new
reviews.text: This hotel is remodeled and opened about 4 weeks prior to our stay.So,the appearance is fresh and new! Our family thought the changes were "Wow." The lobby is contemporary and bright with comfortable seating. There is a business center in the lobby as well as a small enclosed fitness center.
The desk personal was friendly and offered us some restaurant suggestions.When checking out you can leave the key in your room,or return it to the desk.
reviews.title: Clean place

reviews.text: The breakfast center is an open design,and can seat quite a few visitors. The breakfast selection,including the pancake machine ,should satisfy all. The coffee was plentiful,and there was an attendant to refresh and tidy up. There is an indoor pool right next to the breakfast center. I did not use the pool,and I do not think any changes were made to that area.
reviews.title: Nicely Remodeled

reviews.text: Our room was two queen size beds,and the contemporary furniture was placed along one wall. There is a relaxing chair with a pull up table that is perfect for a laptop as well.The design provides more than adequate work space for someone who may need to stay a few days.
reviews.title: Awesome, New, Wow

reviews.text: To keep things simple, it was very clean, updated, great staff, everything worked, beds and pillows were comfortable, and oh did I say clean. I will be telling others who are traveling out to Hershey to stay here.
reviews.title: Will come again and tell others

reviews.text: I booked this hotel after researching hotel prices in the area and reading previous reviews on Tripadvisor that it had been recently rennovated and was a nice, clean place to stay which was close to Hershey Park. We were very pleased with our stay at this Holiday Inn Express. Our room was very clean upon arrival and the air conditioner in the room worked well. It was also relatively quiet which was a pleasant surprise. I will say that the bed was way too firm for me. However the room did offer a choice of soft and firm pillows which did help. We did not have any trouble with hallway noise - I usually always ask for a room on a high floor and away from the elevator.
reviews.title: Great Place and Close to Hershey Park

reviews.text: The free breakfast had both hot and cold items which included some form of eggs, biscuits and gravy, either bacon or sausage, cereal, yogurt, bread items, and hot cinnamon buns. The hotel also had a "make your own" pancake machine, but it was out of service (they were out of refills) 3 out of the 4 mornings we had breakfast. (To be fair, we went down to breakfast on the late side, so it may have been full earlier in the morning). Most of the other items were refilled frequently - and were truly refilled until the end of the breakfast time (6:30 to 9:30am). For the most part, we found the staff friendly, but the staff members we asked were not extremely knowledgeable about the area. They did have print-outs available at the front desk of area restaurants and attractions that did prove to be helpful. It is an easy commute to Hershey Park and there is a Dunkin Donuts Express and Perkins Pancake House (24 hour) almost directly across the street if you want decent food and are not in the mood to explore the area. This hotel was a great value for what we paid, considering other hotels slightly closer to Hershey were at least $50 to $100 more per night than what we paid. We would choose this location again if we ever come back to the Hershey/Lancaster area.
reviews.title: Nice Updated Hotel, but will not return

reviews.text: This is a nicely updated and clean hotel, but the staff left a sour taste. The night staff was under-trained and unprofessional in dealing with a sold-out/noisy weekend with multiple groups throughout the hotel. The thin walls added to the unpleasant experience for ALL guests in the hotel. There was a group that had been in the hotel all week, and apparently had the run of the place during the week. When we arrived at 11:00pm the lobby was overtaken by this group of dance parents. The lobby was VERY loud upon my arrival.
reviews.title: Excellent access to Hersheypark!

reviews.text: Nice hotel, freshly updated. We had not known our room was going to have a refrigerator and microwave - we could have brought more food! But there are several dining options nearby - McDonald's, Perkins, Pizza Hut Express, Harrisburg Pizza. Quiet location and very easy access to Hersheypark. Lingletown Road turns into Hershey Road which dumps you right into the entrance to Hersheypark and Chocolate World. Couldn't be easier! They were also very accommodating when we had to cancel the original first day of our reservation. The only negative was that the a/c cooled well but did not control humidity efficiently. Everything felt damp. But we will be happy to stay here again if we make a return trip to the area.
reviews.title: No Sleep Express, loud parties in lobby are all night were allowed by staff. The attitude of the night staff is unacceptable. Th

description: The Holiday Inn Express® hotel is ideally located in the heart of Pennsylvania. Explore the capital city, or visit the many attractions found in the area, including Indian Echo Caverns, Penn National Race Course, Hersheypark amusement park, ZooAmerica wildlife park and Hershey's Chocolate World, an interactive chocolate experience and a shopper's paradise. The Harrisburg International Airport is 15 miles from the hotel.
